label: Standard
difficulty_tooltip: Opposed Checks.  Opposed Checks. If a check is directly opposed by another character, the difficulty should be increased by 2 if the opponent has a useful trait. For example, if a player tries to convince a heretic they worship the same god, you might increase the difficulty to 7 if the heretic has the Suspicious trait.  The same is true for the opposite situation, reducing the difficulty to 3 if they are Naive.

skull.label: Critical Failure
skull.text: They fail at their goal in a catastrophic way.

under.label: Failure
under.text: They fail at their goal and incur some cost in doing so.

equal.label: Mixed Success
equal.text: They succeed at their goal, but at some cost.

crest.label: Critical Success
crest.text: They succeed at their goal and gain an extra advantage.

label: Attack (Bludgeoning)
tooltip: Onwards! Tear down any who dare stand against our righteous cause!
difficulty_tooltip: Set to equal the defender's current toughness plus protection. If the defender is aware of the attacker, they may spend footing to dodge or block. This increases the difficulty by 1 for each footing spent, with an additional +1 if the defender is blocking using a shield.

skull.label: Fumble
skull.text: Something goes wrong, such as: you lose or break your weapon; you are reduced to D6 arrows; your foe may take an opportunity action against you; an unintended target must suffer damage; you lose all footing and fall prone. Alternatively, the GM may decide your fumble has some other terrible consequence.

penalties.label: Lose or break your weapon
Reduced to D6 arrows
Foe may take an opportunity action against you
You lose all footing and fall prone
Some other terrible consequence

under.label: Off Balance
under.text: Lower your own footing by -1 (to a minimum of 1); if you attacked unarmed, lose -1 toughness.

penalties.label: Lower your own footing by -1, (to a minimum of 1)
Lose -1 toughness

equal.label: Graze
equal.text: Lower your own footing by -1 (to a minimum of 1). The target loses -1 toughness.

penalties.label: Lower your own footing by -1, (to a minimum of 1)

1 over.label: Staggered
1 over.text: The target loses -1 toughness. Additionally, the target loses -2 footing. If they are prone, they instead lose an additional -2 toughness.

target_penalties.label: If prone, instead lose an additional -2 toughness

2 over.label: Battered
2 over.text: The target loses -1 toughness. Additionally, the target loses an additional -1 toughness, then a piece of armour they are wearing gains the ill-fitting property.

target_penalties.label: A piece of armor gains the ill-fitting property

3 over.label: Smashed Face
3 over.text: The target loses -1 toughness. Additionally, the target gains the Smashed Face injury and must resist [death].

4 over.label: Broken
4 over.text: The target loses -1 toughness. Additionally, the target must resist [death]. Even if they succeed, they lose all footing and are knocked unconscious for D6 rounds.

5 over.label: Crushed Arm
5 over.text: The target loses -1 toughness. Additionally, if the target blocked this [attack], the item they used to block is destroyed. Then, they gain the Broken Arm injury and must resist [death].

6 over.label: Staggered
6 over.text: The target loses -1 toughness. Additionally, target falls prone and loses all footing. A piece of armour they are wearing is destroyed and then they suffer bludgeoning damage (again)

crest.label: Critical
crest.text: The target is defeated or killed in a manner of the attacker's choosing. This could be a shot through the heart, a decapitation, or some form of non-lethal removal from the fight.

5 over.label: Pinned Arm
5 over.text: Target loses an additional -1 toughness and drops any item they are holding. They cannot move until they take an open action to free themselves.

label: Corruption
tooltip: Foul miasmas permeate first the flesh, then the soul; an unceasing assault from all sides.
difficulty_tooltip: Always set by the effect that triggered the corruption.

skull.label: Critical
skull.text: You suffer from the corruption. Dice rolled while resolving this corruption are rolled twice, taking the worse value.

equal.label: Imbalance
equal.text: You suffer no ill effects from the corruption but gain the Furious, Exhausted, Bleeding or Uneasy condition.

over.label: Shrug It Off
over.text: You suffer no ill effects from the corruption.

crest.label: Immunity
crest.text: You are immune to this specific corruption for D6 days.

label: Death
tooltip: There is no light to grace the tunnel, only a slow loss of self as your blood soaks the ground.
difficulty_tooltip: Increase the difficulty by 2 if the target has already resisted death since dawn.

under.label: Dying
under.text: You lose all toughness and fall unconscious. At dawn, flip the Doomcoin.  On a crest, you gain +1 toughness; on a skull, you die.

equal.label: Hold Out
equal.text: If you have two action dice, lose an action die. Increase the difficulty of all attempts to resist [death] by 1 until dawn.

over.label: Not Today
over.text: If you have two action dice, lose an action die.

crest.label: Heroic Effort
crest.text: If you have one action die, gain an action die.
